description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically caused by a viral or bacterial infection. Common symptoms include diarrhea, abdominal cramps, nausea, vomiting, and fever.}, {diagnosis: Dehydration

description: A condition caused by the excessive loss of fluids from the body, often due to diarrhea, vomiting, or sweating. Symptoms can include thirst, fatigue, dizziness, and hypotension.}, {diagnosis: Food poisoning

description: Illness caused by consuming contaminated food or drink, often by bacteria, viruses, or parasites. Symptoms can vary but often include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and fever.}, {diagnosis: Vasovagal syncope

description: A sudden drop in blood pressure and heart rate, leading to fainting. It is often triggered by specific stimuli like stress, pain, or dehydration.}, {diagnosis: Viral infection (e.g., norovirus, rotavirus)
description: Viral infections commonly cause gastroenteritis, leading to symptoms like diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, and sometimes fever.}, {diagnosis: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
description: A common disorder that affects the large intestine. Symptoms include cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation.}, {diagnosis: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

description: A group of disorders that cause chronic inflammation in the digestive tract, such as Crohns disease and ulcerative colitis. Symptoms can include diarrhea, abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, and weight loss.}, {diagnosis: Medication side effects
description: Certain medications can cause side effects such as diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and hypotension.}, {diagnosis: Allergic reaction

description: An exaggerated immune response to a foreign substance (allergen). Symptoms can vary widely but may include sneezing, diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and in severe cases, hypotension and syncope.}, {diagnosis: Appendicitis
description: Inflammation of the appendix, a small, finger-shaped pouch that extends from the colon. Symptoms include sudden, severe pain in the lower right abdomen, nausea, vomiting, and fever.}
